body.p: DocBook is a very popular set of tags for describing books, articles, and other prose documents, particularly technical documentation.
DocBook V4 document typeassociation rulesA file is considered to be a DocBook 4 document when one of the following conditions are true:

ul.li: root element name is book or article;
the PUBLIC ID of the document contains the string -//OASIS//DTD DocBook XML.

body.p: DocBook V4 document typeschemaThe schema of DocBook 4 documents is ${frameworks}/docbook/dtd/docbookx.dtd, where ${frameworks} is a subdirectory of the install directory.
The CSS file used for rendering DocBook content is located in ${frameworks}/docbook/css/docbook.css.
DocBook V4 document typeAuthor extensionscatalogsThe XML catalog is stored in ${frameworks}/docbook/catalog.xml.
To watch our video demonstration about editing DocBook documents, go to http://oxygenxml.com/demo/DocBook_Editing_in_Author.html.
